holidays.name: National Crossword Puzzle Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the beloved word game that challenges your vocabulary and problem-solving skills.
holidays.origin: First crosswords appeared in the early 20th century; this day honors their impact on literacy and entertainment.
holidays.funFact: The first-ever crossword puzzle was published in 1913, and December 21 was chosen because it's the birthday of the inventor, Arthur Wynne.

holidays.name: Winter Solstice
holidays.description: The shortest day and longest night of the year in the Northern Hemisphere, marking the official start of winter.
holidays.origin: Ancient cultures worldwide held rituals and festivals to honor the sun's rebirth on this astronomical event.
holidays.funFact: Many modern holidays, including Christmas and New Year, have roots in ancient solstice celebrations.

holidays.name: Ugly Christmas Sweater Day
holidays.description: A quirky, fun day where people proudly wear the most hilariously hideous Christmas sweaters they can find.
holidays.origin: Started in the early 2000s as a humorous way to celebrate the holiday season with kitschy fashion.
holidays.funFact: Ugly Christmas sweater parties have become so popular they've even sparked international competitions with outrageous designs.

holidays.name: National Flashlight Day
holidays.description: A tribute to the handy portable light source that helps us navigate the dark and discover hidden corners.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the invention and widespread use of the flashlight, vital for safety and emergencies.
holidays.funFact: The first flashlight was developed in the late 19th century and used non-rechargeable batteries that only lasted a few hours!
